eg, I cannot use the scan update functionality in the "management configuration".

How did you get into this state?  What do you mean by "scan update functionality in the "management 
configuration""?  Is this in plain vanilla eclipse or in a product built on top of eclipse?

(In reply to comment #2)
> How did you get into this state?  What do you mean by "scan update 
functionality in the "management 
> configuration""?  Is this in plain vanilla eclipse or in a product built on 
top of eclipse?

(In reply to comment #2)
After updating and installing some plugins, like, EMF, GEF, and Spring IDE, 
etc, it shows those above errors in the error view.
eg, when I try to access Menu "help-->Software Updates-->Management 
Configuration--> select one item and right click to update", it tells me that 
there are some errors. that's it. I am not sure which components updates or 
plugins results in these errors. (because the fresh eclipse 3.0.2 does not have 
these errors)

Frank, how did you install those features? Did you just unzip them or used the 
update manager to install ?
If you unzipped, and happend to have a FAT32 file system, you also need to run 
eclipse with -clean.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Frank, how did you install those features? Did you just unzip them or used the 
> update manager to install ?
> If you unzipped, and happend to have a FAT32 file system, you also need to run 
> eclipse with -clean.

Actually, I am sure the installation steps are correct, because I installed them
in the eclipse sdk 3.0.1 and they worked, I am using the same installation way
in eclipse sdk 3.0.2, they just don't work.
by the way, my OS is windows 2000 pro with sp4, and the file system is NTFS.
Too old to keep it as critical.

(In reply to comment #7)
> Too old to keep it as critical.
